title: panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
body:
```

        external/io_etcd_go_bbolt/tx.go:130 +0x8c

        external/io_etcd_go_bbolt/db.go:725 +0x8e
github.com/prysmaticlabs/prombbolt.forEachWithBoltDB.func1(0xc006bdaae0, 0xc006bdaae0, 0xc0007f72d0)
        external/com_github_prysmaticlabs_prombbolt/bucketstatscollector.go:176 +0x52

        external/com_github_prometheus_client_golang/prometheus/registry.go:443 +0x19d

        external/com_github_prometheus_client_golang/prometheus/registry.go:454 +0x599
```

```
prysm@eth2test:~$ cat /data/prysm/configs/beacon.yaml
datadir: "/data/prysm"
log-file: "/data/prysm/logs/beacon/beacon.log"
#http-web3provider: "http://localhost:8545"
graffiti: "MysticRyuujin"
p2p-max-peers: 100
```
If I had to guess, I'd guess unsafe shutdown lead to db corruption?
@MysticRyuujin can you please add a link to the log file?

Unfortunately I don't think my log file contains any useful information. First, my log file was 11GB because 1) Logs don't rotate. 2) My logs were flooded with entries about being unable to process past logs due to a Nethermind RPC issue.

Second, Prysm don't actually log errors like the above error in the log file, the only way to see them is when interactively running. Maybe via journalctrl or something on the service could I see it, but again logs were way too big for me to be able to get that data from over a week ago.
Thanks @MysticRyuujin for reporting. Log rotation can be a good issue to look into

Was there anything else interesting about your environment? Out of disk space?
Were you collecting prometheus metrics at the time?
Not that I'm aware of. I'd just close this. I have no info beyond the log, and the suggestion that perhaps it was an unsafe shutdown.
OK, thanks. Let me know if you see it again please!
